taskbody.context: In this section of the lab you will boot a new EBS-backed instance from the snapshot-backed EMI. As the instance is launched, a new bootable volume will automatically be created from the snapshot registered as an EMI. This volume will be attached to the instance, allowing the instance to boot.

step.cmd: From the front-end host, how many volumes are configured on the Storage Controller? There should not be any. If there are, delete them now.
Launch an EBS-backed instance from the new EMI. In this case the instance has a valid root password so the –k <key_name> option is not necessary.
Monitor instance startup until it is listed with a status of running .
From the front-end host, use SSH to log in to the new instance. The root password is foobar .

info.p: Remain logged in until told to log out.
